hanzi-su-wiki:
財

Значения

Ценное имущество, деньги

Мнемоника

Богатство, т.е. талант 才 к деньгам 貝.

Варианты

财, 戝
purpleculture_pinyin:
cái
wealth, valuables, riches
богатство, ценности, богатство
rtega_mnemonic:
財財RS
财财		wealth, valuables, riches
  • having the talent 才 to amass money 貝: end up wealthy and rich
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 才 indicates the sound; 貝 (money) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 才 [ cái ] ability, talent, gift; just, only
heisig_chinese_memo: If you're a money genius, you can afford a lot of property due to your riches.
heisig_constituent: property, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, genie
koohiiStory1: If you´re a money genius, you can afford a lot of property.
koohiiStory2: The keyword refers to property in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”). Here we have a genie, gulping down oysters. Someone tries to grab an oyster and the genie puts his big arms around his oysters and states his “right of ownership” : “They´re mines, my property!”.
jp_example_words:
財(ざい): fortune, riches
財源(ざいげん): source of funds, resources, finances
財政(ざいせい): economy, financial affairs
文化財(ぶんかざい): cultural assets, cultural property
財産(ざいさん): property, fortune, assets
財布(さいふ): purse, wallet
jp_readingExamples: 財産 (ざいさん), 私財 (しざい), 文化財 (ぶんかざい)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Give shellfish to a genius and they'll have no problem accumulating wealth. Geniuses can make loads of money out of pretty much anything, so shellfish are like easy-mode.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the genius huddled over a pile of shellfish, muttering about all the wealth he'll amass once he's done.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The wealth comes pouring in, once the genius's cyborg (さい) is unveiled. It's a half-man, half-shellfish cyborg that's making him rich! It can even play the xylophone (ざい)!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You'd be wealthy too if you sold that cyborg you made. It may not have any shellfish in it and it can't play the xylophone, but you could change that...
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ノ, 亅 (зазубрина), ハ, 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) genius (才) gets money, wealth and property
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A genius with clams will of course have many riches.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " Bei " to " Cai " sound. The original meaning is property. "Shouwen": "Wealth is what people treasure." Wang Fengyang believes that the connotation of " wealth " in the pre-Qin period is smaller than that of later generations, and it mainly refers to people's food and clothing needs. Such as "Mozi. "Shang Xian 2": "The lord of the princes will kiss their country, and shouldn't they kiss the bow, give up the horse, clothes, and the wealth of the cattle and sheep?" "Under the ghosts": "The ghosts and gods, please do not have. Therefore, it does not share the wealth of wine, richness, and sacrifice." " Cai " was later expanded to become the general term for materials and currency. Such as "Zhou Li. Land official. "Ta Situ" "Foot with Wealth", Zheng Xuan's note: "Wealth means Spring Valley." "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-four Years of Xi Gong": "Stealing people's wealth is still called theft, and if you are greedy for heaven, you can think of your own strength?" "Historical Records. Biography of General Li: "The body of the final broad, more than two thousand stones for more than 40 years, the family has no surplus money, and finally does not talk about family property." See " goods ".

" Cai " is used as " material ", such as "Yi Zhou Shu. "Prince Jin" "Split and Evenly Treasure", Zhu Youzeng's exegesis: "Treasury and material are connected." "Book of Rites. Sacrifice: "Mountains, forests, valleys, and hills are also used by the people." "Laozi. "Chapter Sixty-Eight" Jane 193: "Therefore, the saint always saves people with goodness, but does not abandon people, and things do not abandon wealth (material), which means desire (𢘽) 眀 (ming)."

" Cai " links " cai ". Zhu Junsheng "Shu Wen Tong Xun Ding Sheng": "Wealth, borrowing and talent." Such as "Mencius. "With all my heart": "Those who have virtuousness, those who have wealth." Jiao Xun "Justice": "Wealth is talent." "Chun Qiu Fan Lu. "Be benevolent and know": "If you are not benevolent and have the courage and financial ability, you will be mad and profitable; if you are unwise and argue with wisdom, you will get lost and ride a good horse." Mawangdui Han Tomb silk book "Jingfa. Lines 72-73 of Ming Li: "Everything and wealth (materials), those whose length is not constant, and Qi (its) give up (should) them."

" Cai " also means " decision ". Such as "The Great Dai Li Ji. "Shao Jian": "A ruler has no honorary ministers. The words of the ministers have not been exhausted. Please do all the words of the ministers. The ruler is like wealth." Wang Pinzhen explained: "Wealth, reading means deciding." "Han Shu. "Biography of Sima Qian": "This person is in the princes and generals, he has heard of neighboring countries, and the crime is so unreasonable, he cannot lead his own wealth." Yan Shi's ancient note: "Wealth and decree are the same, ancient common words." "Zhang Jiashan Han Jian. "Zou Zong Shu" Jian 133: "The first sin of Xin Qian in the letter of wealth (decision)."

" Cai " is also commonly referred to as "cai (cai)". Such as "Historical Records. "The Text of Filial Piety": "Taifu sees Ma Yicai's feet, and the rest will be passed on." "Han Shu. "Li Guangsu Jian Chuan": "At the beginning, the second division army was sent out. Cai Lingling was an aid to the soldiers, and the mausoleum was worthy of Shanyu, while the second division had little merit." Shallow, only." "Han Shu. "The Story of Huo Guangjin Rixie": "Light is a person, quietly examines, long fortune is seven feet three inches, white, clear eyebrows, beautiful beard."
humanum_short_description_en: From " Bei " to " Cai " sound. The original meaning is property.
humanum_full_description:
從「貝」，「才」聲。本義是財物。《說文》：「財，人所寶也。」王鳳陽認為先秦時的「財」內涵較後代為小，主要指人的衣食所需。如《墨子．尚賢下》：「則王公大人之親其國家也，不若其親一危弓、罷馬、衣裳、牛羊之財與？」〈明鬼下〉：「鬼神者，固請無有，是以不共其酒醴、粢盛、犧牲之財。」「財」後來才擴大成為物資和貨幣的總稱。如《周禮．地官．大司徒》「以斂財賦」，鄭玄注：「財，謂泉穀。」《左傳．僖公二十四年》：「竊人之財，猶謂之盜，況貪天之功以為己力乎？」《史記．李將軍列傳》：「終廣之身，為二千石四十餘年，家無餘財，終不言家產事。」參見「貨」。

　　「財」通作「材」，如《逸周書．太子晉》「分均天財」，朱右曾集訓校釋：「財與材通。」《禮記．祭法》：「山林、川谷、丘陵，民所取財用也。」北大漢簡《老子．六十八章》簡193：「故聖人恒善救人，而無棄人，物無棄財（材），是謂欲（𢘽）眀（明）。」

　　「財」通「才」。朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲》：「財，叚借又為才。」如《孟子．盡心上》：「有成德者，有達財者。」焦循《正義》：「財，即才也。」《春秋繁露．必仁且知》：「不仁而有勇力財能，則狂而操利兵也；不智而辯慧獧給，則迷而乘良馬也。」馬王堆漢墓帛書《經法．名理》72-73行：「凡萬物羣財（材），絩（佻）長非恒者，亓（其）死心𤻮（應）之。」

　　「財」又通「裁」。如《大戴禮記．少間》：「君無譽臣，臣之言未盡，請盡臣之言，君如財之。」王聘珍解詁：「財，讀曰裁。」《漢書．司馬遷傳》：「此人皆身至王侯將相，聲聞鄰國，及罪至罔加，不能引決自財。」顏師古注：「財與裁同，古通用字。」《張家山漢簡．奏讞書》簡133：「上書言財（裁）新黔首罪。」

　　「財」還通作「纔（才）」。如《史記．孝文本紀》：「太僕見馬遺財足，餘皆以給傳置。」《漢書．李廣蘇建傳》：「初，上遣貳師大軍出，財令陵為助兵，及陵與單于相值，而貳師功少。」顏師古注：「財與纔同，謂淺也，僅也。」《漢書．霍光金日磾傳》：「光為人沈靜詳審，長財七尺三寸，白晳，疏眉目，美須䫇。」

財字的基本解释

財
cái
见“财”。

財字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cái］
［《廣韻》昨哉切，平咍，從。］
“财1”的繁体字。
(1)金钱、物资的总称。
(2)通“材”。原材；材料。
(3)通“才”。资质，才能。
(4)通“裁”。裁制；节制；裁断。
(5)通“纔”。仅仅。
(6)通“纔”。始，刚才。

財字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　財； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页1204第11
〔古文〕㒲【唐韻】昨哉切【集韻】牆來切，?音裁。【說文】人所寶也。【徐曰】可入用者也。【玉篇】納財，謂食穀也，貨也，賂也。【易·繫辭】何以聚人曰財。【註】財，所以資物生也。【書·禹貢】底愼財賦。【傳】所愼者，財貨貢賦。【周禮·天官·大宰】以九賦斂財賄。【註】財，泉穀也。【禮·坊記】先財而後禮。【註】幣帛也。又【禮器】設於地財。【註】財，物也。各是土地之物。　又與裁通。【易·泰卦】后以財成天地之道。【釋文】財，荀作裁。【爾雅·釋言疏】裁、財音義同。【史記·封禪書】民里社各自財以祠。【前漢·郊祀志】作自裁。　又與材通。【孟子】有達財者。　又與纔通。【史記·孝文本紀】太僕見馬遺財足。【註】財，與纔同。　又【集韻】昨代切，音在。義同。　又【韻補】叶前西切。【舜·南風之歌】南風之時兮，可以阜吾民之財兮。○按《唐韻正》支、齊兩韻本通。

考證：〔又【禮器】設於用財。〕　謹照原文用改地。

fiscal
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cái］
["Guangyun" cut yesterday, flat 咍, from. ]
Traditional characters for "财1".
(1) The general term for money and materials.
(2) Through "material". Raw material; material.
(3) Through "talent". Qualifications, talents.
(4) Through "cutting". Adjudication; temperance; adjudication.
(5) Through "talent". only.
(6) Through "talent". Hajime, just now.

Name meaning

cái
вм. 财
Radicals: 貝, 才  (shellfish, genius)
Meaning Mnemonic
Give shellfish to a genius and they'll have no problem accumulating wealth. Geniuses can make loads of money out of pretty much anything, so shellfish are like easy-mode.
Picture the genius huddled over a pile of shellfish, muttering about all the wealth he'll amass once he's done.
Reading Mnemonic
The wealth comes pouring in, once the genius's cyborg (さい) is unveiled. It's a half-man, half-shellfish cyborg that's making him rich! It can even play the xylophone (ざい)!
You'd be wealthy too if you sold that cyborg you made. It may not have any shellfish in it and it can't play the xylophone, but you could change that...
